item.title: Report E-2023080561
item.description:
Report E-2023080561

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NCH experienced a UN3267 Sikadur 52 Part B release from (3) 1-gallon metal pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3-gallons of product released to an 8' x 2' area of the trailer floor and an 8' x 8' area of the concrete lot below the trailer. The crew advised the lids of the pails were crushed due to improper loading causing the release. Oil Gator was deployed and worked into the impacted areas. Once complete, the areas were pH strip tested to confirm neutralization. All waste was then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023080685
item.description:
Report X-2023080685

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080685 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT OVER TO THE QA CAGE DUE TO A WET SPOT ON THE SIDE OF THE PACKAGE. UPON DISCOVERY WE NOTICED ONE OF THE 2 BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP. APPROXIMATELY 16 LIQUID OUNCES OF THE ACID SPILLED OUT IN THE BOX WHICH CONTAMINTATED BOTH BOTTLES. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WE ISOLATED THIS PACKAGE IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE AND MOVED TO THE HAZMAT CAGE. 2. X-2023080687 SequenceEvent: THIS BOX WAS LEFT AT QA2 CAGE IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. WE DISCOVERED 4 ONE GALLON BOTTLES OF ZEP DRIVEWAY CLEANER. TWO OF THE 4 BOTTLES HAD LOOSE CAPS AND THEY LEAKED ON ALL OF THE BOTTLES IN THE BOX WHICH CONTAMINATED ALL CONTENTS IN THIS BOX. DescribePack: LOOSE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WE ISOLATED THIS PACKED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE AND MOVED IT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE UNDER THE HOOD VENT.

item.title: Report X-2023080634
item.description:
Report X-2023080634

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought over to QA department in our building by one of our management team they mentioned the package began leaking while it was being unloaded. DescribePack: Side of the package itself was wet and not looking to good, once I opened the package i then saw the bottles were just placed inside the box with barely ant protection for them at all to prevent the leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Immediately once I noticed that the leaking was happening I immediately placed the box and contents inside of a lined tote to prevent any more spread of the leaking.

item.title: Report X-2023080622
item.description:
Report X-2023080622

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package wet when unloaded from trailer. Package given to QA. DescribePack: 5 gallon jug placed in box for shipping. Although Styrofoam peanuts placed in box, it did not keep it from shifting causing leakage from loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box and Styrofoam peanuts absorbed liquid.

item.title: Report X-2023080692
item.description:
Report X-2023080692

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080692 SequenceEvent: PKG WAS BEING LOADED ONTO THE VAN TO BE DELIVERED BACK TO THE SHIPPER AND WHEN DOING SO THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX WAS NOT SECURE AND ONE OF THE JUGS SLIPPED OUT AND BROKE. THERE WAS NOT ENOUGH TAPE ON THE BOX TO KEEP THE CONTENTS SECURE. BOX OPENED. AREA WAS CLEARED WHILE THE CONTENTS WERE CLEANED UP, PLACED IN A HAZMAT DRUM AND MOVED TO BE PROCESSED. DescribePack: BOTTOM OF BOX NOT SECURLY TAPED. BOX OPENED DURING A PACKAGE HANDLER LOADING THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: DRY CONTENTS TO ABSORB THE LIQUID WAS PLACED ON THE WET SPOTS TILL IT WAS UP OFF THE FLOOR. PACKAGE HANDLER WAS REMOVED FROM THE AREA TILL ALL CLEAN. 2. X-2023080744 SequenceEvent: ITEM WAS DISCOVERED BY THE STATIONS TRASH CANS AND DAMAGE AREA. IT WAS IN A YELLOW HAZMAT DRUM IN HAZMAT BAGS. BROKEN CONTENTS AND CLEAN UP MATERIALS. UNSURE ON HOW THE DAMAGE BOTTLES HAPPENED OR WHEN THIS OCCURED. PKG WAS THEN PROCESSED AS A DAMAGE. DescribePack: UNSURE ON HOW THE PACKAGE FAILURE OCCURED OR WHAT FAILED EXACTLY. THE BOTTLES WERE BUSTED SO I ASSUME THEY WERE DROPPED AND BROKE THAT WAY. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS REVIEWED AND SECURED FOR PROPER PROCESSING AND FOLLOW UP.

item.title: Report E-2023080538
item.description:
Report E-2023080538

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-16
  • City: Charlotte
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ADVANTAGE TANK LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling eastbound on Morehead St near Charlotte, North Carolina when the claimant vehicle failed to yield from Elliott St and struck the right side of the trailer. The impact damaged the loading/unloading lines and resulted in approximately 5 gallons of gasoline being released. The Charlotte Fire Department responded and handled the clean-up.

item.title: Report X-2023080663
item.description:
Report X-2023080663

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in Kann-289 Unload A. QA was alerted to this package at 12:30am. Upon discovery package was leaking on the side of the box. One jug had loose caps and this caused some of the contents to leak out into the outer packaging destroying the packaging and part of the barcode label. An inhouse clean up was done and the package was taken into the QA Hazmat cage in a 20-gallon salvage drum. DescribePack: The failure was do to the closer on the jug not being tightened to the bottle. The jug and the outer packaging were placed into a salvage drum and sealed to prevent further damage. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The cap was tightened back to the jug and placed into a 20-gallon salvage drum and sealed tight.
